instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> vs 00138-A
threads.message: Hi guys working on an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A with no backlight. I only have schematcs for the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> but they layout doesnt match. Is there anything similar to <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A that I can use? I need to know the board layout faround <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>, have a burned pin and I expect its 5V line but not sure so its kinda risky to try and fix.
